title: Lesson A2-2 Assessment: Pluralization and Case Suffixes

questions.question: What is the pattern for forming plural nouns with cases in Georgian?
questions.explanation: The correct pattern is Root + -eb + Case Ending. The -eb marker is inserted between the root and the case suffix.

questions.question: What is the plural Nominative form of წიგნი (ts'igni - book)?
questions.explanation: Plural Nominative: Replace -ი with -ები → წიგნები (ts'ignebi). წიგნებს is Dative plural, წიგნების is Genitive plural.

questions.question: What is the plural Dative form of კატები (kat'ebi - cats)?
questions.explanation: Plural Dative: Root + -eb + -ს → კატებს (kat'ebs). This is used for objects in sentences.

questions.question: What is the plural Genitive form of ბავშვები (bavshvebi - children)?
questions.explanation: Plural Genitive: Root + -eb + -ის → ბავშვების (bavshvebis). This shows possession with plural nouns.

questions.question: In the sentence 'მე ვხედავ კატებს' (I see the cats), why is კატებს used instead of კატები?

options.text: Because it's the direct object (Dative case)

questions.explanation: კატებს is plural Dative because 'the cats' is the direct object of the verb 'I see'. Objects take Dative case, and with plurals, we use the -ებს ending.

questions.question: Match the forms to their cases:
questions.explanation: წიგნები ends in -ები (Nominative plural), წიგნებს ends in -ებს (Dative plural), and წიგნების ends in -ების (Genitive plural).
